Why would they start lowering sale prices?

Bankruptcy means they have to restructure debt and part of that is they need to free up capital.The longer they hold their fleet, the more depreciation, so they have to dump the excess inventory.Once inventory is dumped in bulk, second hand car market will tank. Which will cause them to devalue their fleet and have to sell even more to come up with capital.Think about it, they have thousands of cars reaching the end of the normal warranty period every month, and those normally have all been dumped silently into a healthy used car market. Nowadays, not so healthy market.If you want to check this, just search on Carvana and you will see a lot of generic hertz nissans coming in as inventory from the wholesale.
400 k cars mean nothing.

Auto industry is one of those markets where manufacturers will buy back old inventory and park it to avoid oversupply impacting prices.Unless it legit collapses, or you’re buying directly from hertz, I’m not sure there is going to be a deal.
They are already selling their cars, see the internet.
They should rent out their fleet of unused vehicles to folks who want to drive for Uber. Perhaps the two companies could make a deal to lower costs.
Not enough Uber demand right now for them to rent out cars to Uber drivers and when demand is back, so will the demand for rental cars.
They could be used for deliveries in the meantime, e.g. for Uber Eats.
Doesn’t look too good right now. Equity will be likely completely wiped out and some of the lenders won’t even be made whole if it falls into BK

And try cut better deals with car manufacturers who are also probably struggling to keep car sales going in such an environment.

Accenture is easily the worst company I’ve EVER worked for. They hired me as an entry-level programmer right out of school. I was paid $20K annually, expected to always work 60+ hour weeks, but NEVER log more than 40 hours, because I was legally non-exempt, but they were definitely not going to pay me for overtime. I believe that’s called ghosting hours, and the practice is illegal. I stayed there for a year, just to have something on my resume, and then moved on.Many years later, my salary is now closer to a quarter of a million US dollars. Fuck Accenture forever and always.
